file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 53-01-01-04 - COCKPIT FLOOR PANELS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL COCKPIT FLOOR PANELS - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install Cockpit Floor Panels. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 53-01-01-000-801-A COCKPIT FLOOR PANELS - REMOVAL COCKPIT FLOOR PANELS - INSTALLA- ALL 53-01-01-400-801-A TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 53-01-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-01-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. COCKPIT FLOOR PANELS - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove Cockpit Floor Panels. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-11-01-000-801-A/400 PILOT SEAT - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 220 Fuselage forward section II D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) TT-I-735 Isopropyl alcohol AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the cockpit, RH/LH I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove the pilot/copilot seats (AMM TASK 25-11-01-000-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-01-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the screws (1) that attach the floor panel (2) to the cockpit floor beams. (2) Remove the floor panel (2). WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (3) With a clean cloth soaked in Isopropyl alcohol, clean all floor panels where the work will be done. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-01-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Cockpit Floor Panels - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONES 223 224 B 1. SCREW 1 2 DET. A 2. FLOOR PANEL DET. C C DET. B 1 TORQUE: 1.8 - 2.9 N.m (16 - 26 lb.in) 2 EM145AMM530008B.DGN THE SCREW MUST BE WET WITH COR-BAN 27L. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 53-01-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-01-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. COCKPIT FLOOR PANELS - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the Cockpit Floor Panels. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-11-01-400-801-A/400 PILOT SEAT - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - IPC 53-01-01 COCKPIT FLOOR C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 220 Fuselage forward section II D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the screws available Commercially Acrylic spatula To install polyurethane film available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MEP 09-075 Corrosion-Inhibiting Compound (COR-BAN 27L) AR TT-I-735 Isopropyl alcohol AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Floor Panel IPC 53-01-01 AR EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 53-01-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the cockpit, RH/LH I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of the fuel quantity indication harness is a part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations (Section 6) of the Maintenance Review Board Report (MRB). (2) Install the floor panel (2). WARNING: COR-BAN 27L IS TOXIC TO SKIN, EYES, AND RESPIRATORY TRACT. USE PVC GLOVES AND EYE PROTECTION. USE ONLY IN WELL VENTILATED AREAS. OBEY THE MANUFACTURER’S HEALTH AND SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS. (3) Install the screws (1) that attach the floor panel (2) to the cockpit floor. The screws must be wet with COR-BAN 27L. (4) Tighten the screws (1). NOTE: Apply torque of 1.8 - 2.9 N.m (16 - 26 lbf.in). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the pilot/copilot seats (AMM TASK 25-11-01-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 53-01-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
